meanings.definition: To work together or cooperate closely
meanings.sent1: The team members interwork to complete the project on time.
meanings.sent2: It is important for colleagues to interwork effectively to achieve common goals.
meanings.sent3: The robots interwork seamlessly to assemble the parts, almost like a synchronized dance.
meanings.sent4: The gears in the clock interwork harmoniously to keep time ticking smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The ants interwork tirelessly to build their intricate underground tunnels.

meanings.sent1: The different departments interwork to ensure a smooth flow of information.
meanings.sent2: In a complex ecosystem, all living organisms interwork to maintain balance.
meanings.sent3: The plot twists in the movie interwork in a way that surprises the audience.
meanings.sent4: The characters' storylines interwork to create a compelling narrative.
meanings.sent5: The various components of the system interwork seamlessly to provide efficient service.
